metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.
metadata.keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website

content.text: We still use the map from the previous page: a map centered on London, England.
content.html: We still use the map from the previous page: a map centered on London, England.

content.text: Now we want to zoom when a user is clicking on the marker (We attach an event handler to a marker that zooms the map when clicked).
content.html: Now we want to zoom when a user is clicking on the marker (We attach an event handler to a marker that zooms the map when clicked).

syntaxHighlighting.text: // Zoom to 9 when clicking on marker

syntax_highlighting.text: // Zoom to 9 when clicking on marker

content.code_html:
// Zoom to 9 when clicking on marker
 google.maps.event.addListener(marker,'click',function() {
  map.setZoom(9);
  map.setCenter(marker.getPosition());
});

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // Zoom to 9 when clicking on marker

content.text: We register for event notifications using the addListener() event handler. That method takes an object, an event to listen for, and a function to call when the specified event occurs.
content.html: We register for event notifications using the addListener() event handler. That method takes an object, an event to listen for, and a function to call when the specified event occurs.

content.text: Here, we save the zoom changes and pan the map back after 3 seconds:
content.html: Here, we save the zoom changes and pan the map back after 3 seconds:

content.code_html:
google.maps.event.addListener(marker,'click',function() {
  var pos = map.getZoom();
  map.setZoom(9);
  map.setCenter(marker.getPosition());
  window.setTimeout(function() {map.setZoom(pos);},3000);
});

content.text: Open an InfoWindow When Clicking on The Marker
Click on the marker to show an infowindow with some text:
content.html: Click on the marker to show an infowindow with some text:

content.code_html:
var infowindow = new google.maps.InfoWindow({
  content:"Hello World!"
});

google.maps.event.addListener(marker, 'click', function() {
  infowindow.open(map,marker);
});

content.text: Set Markers and Open InfoWindow for Each Marker
Run a function when the user clicks on the map.
content.html: Run a function when the user clicks on the map.

content.text: The placeMarker() function places a marker where the user has clicked, and shows an infowindow with the latitudes and longitudes of the marker:
content.html: The placeMarker() function places a marker where the user has clicked, and shows an infowindow with the latitudes and longitudes of the marker:

content.code_html:
google.maps.event.addListener(map, 'click', function(event) {
  placeMarker(map, event.latLng);
});

function placeMarker(map, location) {
  var marker = new google.maps.Marker({
    position: location,
    map: map
  });
  var infowindow = new google.maps.InfoWindow({
    content: 'Latitude: ' + location.lat() +
    '<br>Longitude: ' + location.lng()
  });
  infowindow.open(map,marker);
}
